contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=March 2007}} '''Joaquim Ferreira''' was a [[Boer]] commandant who saw action at [[Majuba]] and [[Ingwavuma]]. He was responsible for negotiating the transfer of land east of the [[Lebombo Mountains]] to the [[South African Republic]]. His plans were frustrated by the actions of Sir [[Charles Saunders (administrator)|Charles Saunders]] who annexed the territory which became known as [[British Maputaland]]. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Ferreira, Joaquim | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ferreira, Joaquim}} [[Category:South African military personnel]] [[Category:People of the First Boer War]] [[Category:History of KwaZulu-Natal]] [[Category:History of South Africa]] {{SouthAfrica-mil-bio-stub}}
